comment.displayText: This will install the Oracle Retail Point-Of-Service application.

comment.explanatoryText: The Point of Service Installation Guide provides details on every value requested by this installer. Please read it before proceeding.

comment.displayText: Click the 'Next' button to proceed to the next screen.

comment.explanatoryText: If you have a previous version of POS installed, please uninstall it before you proceed.

comment.displayText: Please enter the supported languages
Please choose the tier type for this installation:
Please choose the owner for this installation:
Please choose the installation directory:
Please choose the JRE 1.6.x installation directory:
* Note * JRE 1.6.x is required.
Please select the JRE 1.6.x vendor:
Please enter the hostname of the computer running the Store Server
What port do you want to use for the Store Server? Default is 1300

comment.explanatoryText: Please enter the 5 digit store id. Pad with leading zeros if necessary.

comment.displayText: Please enter your register number.
The default register number is 129.
Please select the applications to integrate with Oracle Point-Of-Service:

comment.explanatoryText: Select method used to send Return Result messages to Oracle RM

select.displayText: Select result messaging option for Oracle RM

comment.displayText: Please select the application server you would like to use:

page.name: WASJars
page.displayText: Websphere Application Server: Third Party Jars

comment.displayText: Please select the correct jars location:
Please select the database you would like to use:
Provide the details for the POS schema user
that will create the schema objects.
Provide the details for the POS schema user
Provide the details for the POS schema user

comment.explanatoryText: The database schema must be created and populated before the POS application is operational. If you are creating database through BackOffice application, skip this option

option.text: Skip schema creation and data loading

comment.explanatoryText: The Sample Dataset is available on the Oracle Software Delivery Cloud

comment.displayText: Please select the secure options from the below list:
Provide the ssl port for the POS data source user
Provide the ssl port for the POS data source user
Please select location for Transaction Retrieval:
Enter the requested information regarding the Scratchpad Database:
Enter the requested information regarding the Scratchpad Database:
Enter the requested information regarding the Scratchpad Database:

comment.explanatoryText: The scratchpad database schema must be created prior to launching the POS application so that the transactions can be retrieved from CentralOffice.
If No is selected, the installer will assume that the schema already exists and will not attempt to recreate the database schema.
A value of "Yes" indicates that secure RMI will be used. A value of "No" indicates that secure RMI will not be used.

comment.displayText: Should RMI calls be subject to timeout? Typically set to yes when CTR is enabled.
Enter the username and password for the POS administrator account.
The password must satisfy the following criteria:
- Contain at least one alphabetic character
- Contain at least one numeric character
- At least seven characters in length

page.name: EnableWebservices
page.displayText: Enable Transaction and Customer retrieval Web Services

comment.explanatoryText: A value of "Yes" indicates that Central Office Web Services will be used for Transaction and Customer retrievals. A value of "No" indicates that ORCO Web Services will not be used and instead ORPOS makes an RMI call which will not support Clustering.
A value of "Yes" indicates webservice communication will happen over HTTPS. A value of "No" indicates webservice communication will happen over HTTP

text.displayText: User Id authorized to access webservice

comment.explanatoryText: Please enter the port for the selected protocol

comment.displayText: The following journaling options are available:
Journal Entries written to JMS Queue or Webservice will be sent to the Corporate Office.

option.text: Write Journal Entries to JMS Queue
Write Journal Entries to a Webservice
Do not Write Journal Entries to CentralOffice

comment.displayText: The following journaling options are available:
Journal Entries written to JMS Queue or Webservice will be sent to the Corporate Office.

option.text: Write Journal Entries to JMS Queue
Do not Write Journal Entries to CentralOffice

comment.explanatoryText: Select JMS SSL Level?

comment.displayText: Please select the required SIM integration features:

validated.displayText: Enter the Oracle Retail SIM Webservice URL

comment.displayText: WebService Password Enabled?
comment.explanatoryText: A value of "Yes" indicates that Webservice is Password enabled.

comment.displayText: Enter User ID and Password for SIM Webservice
(leave blank if Webservice is not Password enabled)
Please select the required SIM integration features:

page.name: EnableSiebelWebServiceOverSSL
page.displayText: Enable POS-Siebel Webservice access over SSL

comment.explanatoryText: A value of "Yes" indicates webservice communication will happen over HTTPS. A value of "No" indicates webservice communication will happen over HTTP
A value of "Siebel" indicates using siebel specific authentication. A value of "WS-Security" indicates sending and receiving of user credentials in a standards-compliant manner.
Please enter configuration details for Siebel

text.displayText: User Id authorized to access my store

password.displayText: Password of my store authorized user

text.displayText: User Id authorized to access all stores

password.displayText: Password of all stores authorized user

page.name: Labels and Tags Webservice over SSL
page.displayText: Enable Labels and Tags WebService over SSL

comment.explanatoryText: A value of "Yes" indicates webservice communication will happen over HTTPS. A value of "No" indicates webservice communication will happen over HTTP
Enter User ID and Password for Labels and Tags Webservice

text.displayText: Labels and Tags Webservice User ID

comment.explanatoryText: Please enter configuration details for the Oracle Returns Management instance. If BackOffice is integrated with ReturnsManagement, use the BackOffice server information on this screen

text.displayText: User Id authorized to access queue manager

comment.explanatoryText: A value of "Yes" indicates that secure JMS communications will be used. A value of "No" indicates that secure JMS communication will not be used for Returns Management

comment.explanatoryText: A value of "Yes" indicates webservice communication will happen over HTTPS. A value of "No" indicates webservice communication will happen over HTTP

comment.explanatoryText: Please enter the port for the selected protocol
A value of "Yes" indicates that eReceipt will be enabled. A value of "No" indicates that eReceipt will not be used
Please enter eReceipt values
A value of "Yes" indicates that taxation will be VAT. A value of "No" indicates that taxation will not be VAT.
Please select the RTLog export options:

WARNING: The simulated key management package bundled with Oracle Retail applications is not PA-DSS nor PCI-DSS compliant. It is made available as a convenience for Oracle Retail consultants, integrators, and customers. If you use the simulated key manager you will not be PCI-DSS compliant; therefore, the simulated key manager should be replaced with a compliant key manager.
Enter the following information to configure the Java Key Store (JKS) for POS:

comment.displayText: Important note about RSA Key Manager:.

comment.explanatoryText: To use RSA Key Manager v3.1 you must have installed the Java Cryptography Extension Unlimited Strength Jurisdiction Policy Files for Java 6.0

comment.displayText: Click the 'Next' button to proceed to the next screen.

- Contain at least one alphabetic character
- Contain at least one numeric character
- At least seven characters in length
Please enter the details for your key store provider
